DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study verify effect anteroposterior talus mobilization range motion , pain , functional capacity participant sub-acute chronic ankle injury .
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study verify acute effect ( one session ) chronic ( six session ) follow-up anteroposterior talus mobilization Maitland 's grade III range motion , pain , functional capacity participant sub-acute chronic ankle injury . Thirty eight volunteer subject ( male female ) participate study minimum 18 maximum 59 year old . The volunteer allocate two group : experimental control . The variable relate range motion , pain functional capacity measure biplane goniometer , Visual Analog Scale Foot Ankle Ability Measure respectively four moment : 1- baseline ; 2- first intervention ; 3- sixth intervention ( two week ) ; 4- follow-up ( one month ) . The experimental group receive anteroposterior articular mobilization talus control group receive manual contact .
DOC.criteria: unilateral traumatic injury ankle least two week maximum eight month least 5ยบ limitation passive dorsiflexion comparison contralateral side another physical therapy treatment lesion able unload partial total body weight use analgesic provide informed consent receive explanation procedure pertinent information regard study joint blockage surgical fixation ankylosis presence vascular , rheumatic , neurological neoplastic disease lower limb open contagious lesion ankle region pain palpation region anterior ankle
